message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.CC, cs.SI

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper deals with codes and their length, which are concepts related to information theory. 
2. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper discusses the construction of codes and their properties, which are topics related to data structures and algorithms. 
3. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper deals with locally repairable codes, which are used in distributed storage systems. 
4. cs.CC (Computational Complexity) - The paper discusses the length of codes and derives a new bound on the code length, which are topics related to computational complexity. 
5. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) - The paper discusses the recoverable erasure patterns of codes, which are relevant in the context of network coding and distributed storage systems.
